directives.description: The @deprecated built-in directive is used within the type system definition language to indicate deprecated portions of a GraphQL service's schema, such as deprecated fields on a type, arguments on a field, input fields on an input type, or values of an enum type.
directives.name: deprecated

directives.description: The @include directive may be provided for fields, fragment spreads, and inline fragments, and allows for conditional inclusion during execution as described by the if argument.
directives.name: include

directives.description: The @skip directive may be provided for fields, fragment spreads, and inline fragments, and allows for conditional exclusion during execution as described by the if argument.
directives.name: skip

directives.description: The @specifiedBy built-in directive is used within the type system definition language to provide a scalar specification URL for specifying the behavior of custom scalar types.
directives.name: specifiedBy

types.description:
Artifact represents the artifact and contains a digest field

Both field are mandatory and canonicalized to be lowercase.

If having a `checksum` Go object, `algorithm` can be
`strings.ToLower(string(checksum.Algorithm))` and `digest` can be
`checksum.Value`.
types.name: Artifact

types.description:
ArtifactInputSpec is the same as Artifact, but used as mutation input.

Both arguments will be canonicalized to lowercase.
types.name: ArtifactInputSpec

types.description:
ArtifactSpec allows filtering the list of artifacts to return.

Both arguments will be canonicalized to lowercase.
types.name: ArtifactSpec

types.description: The `Boolean` scalar type represents `true` or `false`.
types.name: Boolean

types.description:
Builder represents the builder such as (FRSCA or github actions).

Currently builders are identified by the `uri` field, which is mandatory.
types.name: Builder

types.description: BuilderInputSpec is the same as Builder, but used for mutation ingestion.
types.name: BuilderInputSpec

types.description: BuilderSpec allows filtering the list of builders to return.
types.name: BuilderSpec

types.description:
CVE represents common vulnerabilities and exposures. It contains the year along
with the CVE ID.

The year is mandatory.

This node is a singleton: backends guarantee that there is exactly one node
with the same `year` value.
types.name: CVE

types.description:
CVEId is the actual ID that is given to a specific vulnerability

The `id` field is mandatory and canonicalized to be lowercase.

This node can be referred to by other parts of GUAC.
types.name: CVEId

types.description: CVEInputSpec is the same as CVESpec, but used for mutation ingestion.
types.name: CVEInputSpec

types.description: CVESpec allows filtering the list of cves to return.
types.name: CVESpec

types.description:
CertifyBad is an attestation represents when a package, source or artifact is considered bad

subject - union type that can be either a package, source or artifact object type
justification (property) - string value representing why the subject is considered bad
origin (property) - where this attestation was generated from (based on which document)
collector (property) - the GUAC collector that collected the document that generated this attestation

Note: Attestation must occur at the PackageName or the PackageVersion or at the SourceName.
types.name: CertifyBad

types.description:
CertifyBadInputSpec is the same as CertifyBad but for mutation input.

All fields are required.
types.name: CertifyBadInputSpec

types.description:
CertifyBadSpec allows filtering the list of CertifyBad to return.
Note: Package, Source or artifact must be specified but not at the same time
For package - a PackageName or PackageVersion must be specified (name or name, version, qualifiers and subpath)
For source - a SourceName must be specified (name, tag or commit)
types.name: CertifyBadSpec

types.description:
CertifyPkg is an attestation that represents when a package objects are similar

packages (subject) - list of package objects
justification (property) - string value representing why the packages are similar
origin (property) - where this attestation was generated from (based on which document)
collector (property) - the GUAC collector that collected the document that generated this attestation
types.name: CertifyPkg

types.description:
CertifyPkgInputSpec is the same as CertifyPkg but for mutation input.

All fields are required.
types.name: CertifyPkgInputSpec

types.description:
CertifyPkgSpec allows filtering the list of CertifyPkg to return.

Specifying just the package allows to query for all similar packages (if they exist)
types.name: CertifyPkgSpec

types.description:
CertifyScorecard is an attestation which represents the scorecard of a
particular source repository.

fields.description: The source repository that is being scanned (attestation subject)
fields.name: source

fields.description: The Scorecard attached to the repository (attestation object)
fields.name: scorecard

types.name: CertifyScorecard

types.description: CertifyScorecardSpec allows filtering the list of CertifyScorecard to return.
types.name: CertifyScorecardSpec

types.description:
CertifyVEXStatement is an attestation that represents when a package or artifact has a VEX about a specific vulnerability (CVE or GHSA)

subject - union type that represents a package or artifact
vulnerability (object) - union type that consists of cve or ghsa
justification (property) - justification for VEX
knownSince (property) - timestamp of the VEX (exact time in RFC 3339 format)
origin (property) - where this attestation was generated from (based on which document)
collector (property) - the GUAC collector that collected the document that generated this attestation
types.name: CertifyVEXStatement

types.description:
CertifyVEXStatementSpec allows filtering the list of CertifyVEXStatement to return.
Only package or artifact and CVE or GHSA can be specified at once.
types.name: CertifyVEXStatementSpec

types.description: CertifyVuln is an attestation that represents when a package has a vulnerability

fields.description: package (subject) - the package object type that represents the package
fields.name: package

fields.description: vulnerability (object) - union type that consists of osv, cve or ghsa
fields.name: vulnerability

fields.description: metadata (property) - contains all the vulnerability metadata
fields.name: metadata

types.name: CertifyVuln

types.description:
CertifyVulnSpec allows filtering the list of CertifyVuln to return.

Specifying just the package allows to query for all vulnerabilities associated with the package.
Only OSV, CVE or GHSA can be specified at once
types.name: CertifyVulnSpec

types.description: CveOrGhsa is a union of CVE and GHSA.
types.name: CveOrGhsa

types.description:
CveOrGhsaInput allows using CveOrGhsa union as
input type to be used in mutations.
Exactly one of the value must be set to non-nil.
types.name: CveOrGhsaInput

types.description:
CveOrGhsaSpec allows using CveOrGhsa union as
input type to be used in read queries.
Exactly one of the value must be set to non-nil.
types.name: CveOrGhsaSpec

types.description: The `Float` scalar type represents signed double-precision fractional values as specified by [IEEE 754](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IEEE_floating_point).
types.name: Float

types.description:
GHSA represents GitHub security advisories.

We create a separate node to allow retrieving all GHSAs.
types.name: GHSA

types.description:
GHSAId is the actual ID that is given to a specific vulnerability on GitHub

The `id` field is mandatory and canonicalized to be lowercase.

This node can be referred to by other parts of GUAC.
types.name: GHSAId

types.description: GHSAInputSpec is the same as GHSASpec, but used for mutation ingestion.
types.name: GHSAInputSpec

types.description:
GHSASpec allows filtering the list of GHSA to return.

The argument will be canonicalized to lowercase.
types.name: GHSASpec

types.description:
HasSBOM is an attestation represents that a package object or source object has an SBOM associated with a uri

subject - union type that can be either a package or source object type
uri (property) - identifier string for the SBOM
origin (property) - where this attestation was generated from (based on which document)
collector (property) - the GUAC collector that collected the document that generated this attestation

Note: Only package object or source object can be defined. Not both.
types.name: HasSBOM

types.description:
HasSBOMInputSpec is the same as HasSBOM but for mutation input.

All fields are required.
types.name: HasSBOMInputSpec

types.description:
HashEqualSpec allows filtering the list of HasSBOM to return.

Only the package or source can be added, not both. HasSourceAt will be used to create the package to source
relationship.
types.name: HasSBOMSpec

types.description: HasSLSA records that a subject node has a SLSA attestation.

fields.description: The subject of SLSA attestation: package, source, or artifact.
fields.name: subject

fields.description: The SLSA attestation.
fields.name: slsa

types.name: HasSLSA

types.description: HasSLSASpec allows filtering the list of HasSLSA to return.
types.name: HasSLSASpec

types.description:
HasSourceAt is an attestation represents that a package object has a source object since a timestamp

package (subject) - the package object type that represents the package
source (object) - the source object type that represents the source
knownSince (property) - timestamp when this was last checked (exact time)
justification (property) - string value representing why the package has a source specified
origin (property) - where this attestation was generated from (based on which document)
collector (property) - the GUAC collector that collected the document that generated this attestation
types.name: HasSourceAt

types.description:
HasSourceAtInputSpec is the same as HasSourceAt but for mutation input.

All fields are required.
types.name: HasSourceAtInputSpec

types.description: HasSourceAtSpec allows filtering the list of HasSourceAt to return.
types.name: HasSourceAtSpec

types.description:
HashEqual is an attestation that represents when two artifact hash are similar based on a justification.

artifacts (subject) - the artifacts (represented by algorithm and digest) that are equal
justification (property) - string value representing why the artifacts are the equal
origin (property) - where this attestation was generated from (based on which document)
collector (property) - the GUAC collector that collected the document that generated this attestation
types.name: HashEqual

types.description:
HashEqualInputSpec is the same as HashEqual but for mutation input.

All fields are required.
types.name: HashEqualInputSpec

types.description:
HashEqualSpec allows filtering the list of HashEqual to return.

Specifying just the artifacts allows to query for all equivalent artifacts (if they exist)
types.name: HashEqualSpec

types.description: The `ID` scalar type represents a unique identifier, often used to refetch an object or as key for a cache. The ID type appears in a JSON response as a String; however, it is not intended to be human-readable. When expected as an input type, any string (such as "4") or integer (such as 4) input value will be accepted as an ID.
types.name: ID

types.description: The `Int` scalar type represents non-fractional signed whole numeric values. Int can represent values between -(2^31) and 2^31 - 1.
types.name: Int

types.description:
IsDependency is an attestation that represents when a package is dependent on another package

package (subject) - the package object type that represents the package
dependentPackage (object) - the package object type that represents the packageName (cannot be to the packageVersion)
versionRange (property) - string value for version range that applies to the dependent package
justification (property) - string value representing why the artifacts are the equal
origin (property) - where this attestation was generated from (based on which document)
collector (property) - the GUAC collector that collected the document that generated this attestation
types.name: IsDependency

types.description:
IsDependencyInputSpec is the same as IsDependency but for mutation input.

All fields are required.
types.name: IsDependencyInputSpec

types.description:
IsDependencySpec allows filtering the list of IsDependency to return.

Note: the package object must be defined to return its dependent packages.
Dependent Packages must represent the packageName (cannot be the packageVersion)
types.name: IsDependencySpec

types.description:
IsOccurrence is an attestation represents when either a package or source is represented by an artifact

Note: Package or Source must be specified but not both at the same time.
Attestation must occur at the PackageVersion or at the SourceName.

fields.description: subject - union type that can be either a package or source object type
fields.name: subject

fields.description: artifact (object) - artifact that represent the the package or source
fields.name: artifact

fields.description: justification (property) - string value representing why the package or source is represented by the specified artifact
fields.name: justification

fields.description: origin (property) - where this attestation was generated from (based on which document)
fields.name: origin

fields.description: collector (property) - the GUAC collector that collected the document that generated this attestation
fields.name: collector

types.name: IsOccurrence

types.description:
IsOccurrenceInputSpec is the same as IsOccurrence but for mutation input.

All fields are required.
types.name: IsOccurrenceInputSpec

types.description:
IsOccurrenceSpec allows filtering the list of IsOccurrence to return.
Note: Package or Source must be specified but not both at the same time
For package - PackageVersion must be specified (version, qualifiers and subpath)
or it defaults to empty string for version, subpath and empty list for qualifiers
For source - a SourceName must be specified (name, tag or commit)
types.name: IsOccurrenceSpec

types.description:
IsVulnerability is an attestation that represents when an OSV ID represents a CVE or GHSA

osv (subject) - the osv object type that represents OSV and its ID
vulnerability (object) - union type that consists of cve or ghsa
justification (property) - the reason why the osv ID represents the cve or ghsa
origin (property) - where this attestation was generated from (based on which document)
collector (property) - the GUAC collector that collected the document that generated this attestation
types.name: IsVulnerability

types.description:
IsVulnerabilityInputSpec is the same as IsVulnerability but for mutation input.

All fields are required.
types.name: IsVulnerabilityInputSpec

types.description:
IsVulnerabilitySpec allows filtering the list of IsVulnerability to return.
Only CVE or GHSA can be specified at once.
types.name: IsVulnerabilitySpec

types.description: MatchFlags is used to input the PkgMatchType enum.
types.name: MatchFlags

fields.description: Ingest a new artifact. Returns the ingested artifact
fields.name: ingestArtifact

fields.description: Ingest a new builder. Returns the ingested builder
fields.name: ingestBuilder

fields.description: Adds a certification that two packages are similar
fields.name: ingestCertifyBad

fields.description: Adds a certification that two packages are similar
fields.name: ingestCertifyPkg

fields.description: Certifies the Scorecard scanning of a source repository
fields.name: certifyScorecard

fields.description: certify that an either a package or artifact has an associated VEX for a CVE or GHSA
fields.name: ingestVEXStatement

fields.description: certify that a package is vulnerable to a vulnerability (OSV, CVE or GHSA)
fields.name: ingestVulnerability

fields.description: Ingest a new CVE. Returns the ingested object
fields.name: ingestCVE

fields.description: Ingest a new GHSA. Returns the ingested object
fields.name: ingestGHSA

fields.description: Certifies that a package or a source has SBOM at the URI
fields.name: ingestHasSBOM

fields.description:
Ingests a SLSA attestation.

Note that materials and builder are extracted as separate arguments. This is
because this ingestion method assumes that the subject and the materials are
already ingested and only creates the SLSA node.
fields.name: ingestSLSA

fields.description:
Ingests a set of packages, sources, and artifacts.

This is a helper mutation for ingesting SLSA nodes. It should be more
efficient to call this method to ingest a set materials instead of ingesting
them one by one.
fields.name: ingestMaterials

fields.description: Adds a certification that a package (either at the version level or package name level) is associated with the source
fields.name: ingestHasSourceAt

fields.description: certify that two artifacts are the same (hashes are equal)
fields.name: ingestHashEqual

fields.description: Adds dependency between two packages
fields.name: ingestDependency

fields.description: Adds an artifact as an occurrence for either a package or a source
fields.name: ingestOccurrence

fields.description: certify that a OSV is associated with either a CVE or GHSA
fields.name: ingestIsVulnerability

fields.description: Ingest a new OSV. Returns the ingested object
fields.name: ingestOSV

fields.description: Ingest a new package. Returns the ingested package trie
fields.name: ingestPackage

fields.description: Ingest a new source. Returns the ingested source trie
fields.name: ingestSource

types.description:
OSV represents an Open Source Vulnerability.

We create a separate node to allow retrieving all OSVs.
types.name: OSV

types.description:
OSVId is the actual ID that is given to a specific vulnerability.

The `id` field is mandatory and canonicalized to be lowercase.

This maps to a vulnerability ID specific to the environment (e.g., GHSA ID or
CVE ID).

This node can be referred to by other parts of GUAC.
types.name: OSVId

types.description: OSVInputSpec is the same as OSVSpec, but used for mutation ingestion.
types.name: OSVInputSpec

types.description: OSVSpec allows filtering the list of OSV to return.
types.name: OSVSpec

types.description: OsvCveGhsaObject is a union of OSV, CVE and GHSA. Any of these objects can be specified for vulnerability
types.name: OsvCveOrGhsa

types.description:
OsvCveOrGhsaInput allows using OsvCveOrGhsa union as
input type to be used in mutations.
Exactly one of the value must be set to non-nil.
types.name: OsvCveOrGhsaInput

types.description:
OsvCveOrGhsaSpec allows using OsvCveOrGhsa union as
input type to be used in read queries.
Exactly one of the value must be set to non-nil.
types.name: OsvCveOrGhsaSpec

types.description:
Package represents a package.

In the pURL representation, each Package matches a `pkg:<type>` partial pURL.
The `type` field matches the pURL types but we might also use `"guac"` for the
cases where the pURL representation is not complete or when we have custom
rules.

This node is a singleton: backends guarantee that there is exactly one node
with the same `type` value.

Also note that this is named `Package`, not `PackageType`. This is only to make
queries more readable.
types.name: Package

types.description:
PackageName is a name for packages.

In the pURL representation, each PackageName matches the
`pkg:<type>/<namespace>/<name>` pURL.

Names are always mandatory.

This is the first node in the trie that can be referred to by other parts of
GUAC.
types.name: PackageName

types.description:
PackageNamespace is a namespace for packages.

In the pURL representation, each PackageNamespace matches the
`pkg:<type>/<namespace>/` partial pURL.

Namespaces are optional and type specific. Because they are optional, we use
empty string to denote missing namespaces.
types.name: PackageNamespace

types.description: PackageOrArtifact is a union of Package and Artifact. Any of these objects can be specified
types.name: PackageOrArtifact

types.description:
PackageOrArtifactInput allows using PackageOrArtifact union as
input type to be used in mutations.
Exactly one of the value must be set to non-nil.
types.name: PackageOrArtifactInput

types.description:
PackageOrArtifactSpec allows using PackageOrArtifact union as
input type to be used in read queries.
Exactly one of the value must be set to non-nil.
types.name: PackageOrArtifactSpec

types.description: PackageOrSource is a union of Package and Source. Any of these objects can be specified
types.name: PackageOrSource

types.description:
PackageOrSourceInput allows using PackageOrSource union as
input type to be used in mutations.
Exactly one of the value must be set to non-nil.
types.name: PackageOrSourceInput

types.description:
PackageOrSourceSpec allows using PackageOrSource union as
input type to be used in read queries.
Exactly one of the value must be set to non-nil.
types.name: PackageOrSourceSpec

types.description:
PackageQualifier is a qualifier for a package, a key-value pair.

In the pURL representation, it is a part of the `<qualifiers>` part of the
`pkg:<type>/<namespace>/<name>@<version>?<qualifiers>` pURL.

Qualifiers are optional, each Package type defines own rules for handling them,
and multiple qualifiers could be attached to the same package.

This node cannot be directly referred by other parts of GUAC.
types.name: PackageQualifier

types.description:
PackageQualifierInputSpec is the same as PackageQualifier, but usable as
mutation input.

GraphQL does not allow input types to contain composite types and does not allow
composite types to contain input types. So, although in this case these two
types are semantically the same, we have to duplicate the definition.

Both fields are mandatory.
types.name: PackageQualifierInputSpec

types.description:
PackageQualifierSpec is the same as PackageQualifier, but usable as query
input.

GraphQL does not allow input types to contain composite types and does not allow
composite types to contain input types. So, although in this case these two
types are semantically the same, we have to duplicate the definition.

Keys are mandatory, but values could also be `null` if we want to match all
values for a specific key.

TODO(mihaimaruseac): Formalize empty vs null when the schema is fully done
types.name: PackageQualifierSpec

types.description: PackageSourceOrArtifact is a union of Package, Source, and Artifact.
types.name: PackageSourceOrArtifact

types.description:
PackageSourceOrArtifactInput allows using PackageSourceOrArtifact union as
input type to be used in mutations.

Exactly one of the value must be set to non-nil.
types.name: PackageSourceOrArtifactInput

types.description:
PackageSourceOrArtifactSpec allows using PackageSourceOrArtifact union as
input type to be used in read queries.

Exactly one of the value must be set to non-nil.
types.name: PackageSourceOrArtifactSpec

types.description:
PackageVersion is a package version.

In the pURL representation, each PackageName matches the
`pkg:<type>/<namespace>/<name>@<version>` pURL.

Versions are optional and each Package type defines own rules for handling them.
For this level of GUAC, these are just opaque strings.

This node can be referred to by other parts of GUAC.

Subpath and qualifiers are optional. Lack of qualifiers is represented by an
empty list and lack of subpath by empty string (to be consistent with
optionality of namespace and version). Two nodes that have different qualifiers
and/or subpath but the same version mean two different packages in the trie
(they are different). Two nodes that have same version but qualifiers of one are
a subset of the qualifier of the other also mean two different packages in the
trie.
types.name: PackageVersion

types.description:
PkgInputSpec specifies a package for a mutation.

This is different than PkgSpec because we want to encode mandatory fields:
`type` and `name`. All optional fields are given empty default values.
types.name: PkgInputSpec

types.description:
PkgMatchType is an enum to determine if the attestation should be done at the
specific version or package name
types.name: PkgMatchType

types.description:
PkgNameSpec is used for IsDependency to input dependent packages. This is different from PkgSpec
as the IsDependency attestation should only be allowed to be made to the packageName node and not the
packageVersion node. Versions will be handled by the version_range in the IsDependency attestation node.
types.name: PkgNameSpec

types.description:
PkgSpec allows filtering the list of packages to return.

Each field matches a qualifier from pURL. Use `null` to match on all values at
that level. For example, to get all packages in GUAC backend, use a PkgSpec
where every field is `null`.

Empty string at a field means matching with the empty string. If passing in
qualifiers, all of the values in the list must match. Since we want to return
nodes with any number of qualifiers if no qualifiers are passed in the input, we
must also return the same set of nodes it the qualifiers list is empty. To match
on nodes that don't contain any qualifier, set `matchOnlyEmptyQualifiers` to
true. If this field is true, then the qualifiers argument is ignored.
types.name: PkgSpec

fields.description: Returns all artifacts
fields.name: artifacts

fields.description: Returns all builders
fields.name: builders

fields.description: Returns all CertifyBad
fields.name: CertifyBad

fields.description: Returns all CertifyPkg
fields.name: CertifyPkg

fields.description: Returns all Scorecard certifications matching the filter
fields.name: scorecards

fields.description: Returns all CertifyVEXStatement
fields.name: CertifyVEXStatement

fields.description: Returns all CertifyVuln
fields.name: CertifyVuln

fields.description: Returns all CVEs
fields.name: cve

fields.description: Returns all GHSA nodes
fields.name: ghsa

fields.description: Returns all HasSBOM
fields.name: HasSBOM

fields.description: Returns all SLSA attestations matching the filter
fields.name: HasSLSA

fields.description: Returns all HasSourceAt
fields.name: HasSourceAt

fields.description: Returns all HashEqual
fields.name: HashEqual

fields.description: Returns all IsDependency
fields.name: IsDependency

fields.description: Returns all IsOccurrence
fields.name: IsOccurrence

fields.description: Returns all IsVulnerability
fields.name: IsVulnerability

fields.description: Returns all OSV
fields.name: osv

fields.description: Returns all packages
fields.name: packages

fields.description: Returns all sources
fields.name: sources

types.description:
SLSA contains all of the fields present in a SLSA attestation.

The materials and builders are objects of the HasSLSA predicate, everything
else are properties extracted from the attestation.

We also include fields to specify under what conditions the check was performed
(time of scan, version of scanners, etc.) as well as how this information got
included into GUAC (origin document and the collector for that document).

fields.description: Sources of the build resulting in subject (materials)
fields.name: builtFrom

fields.description: Builder performing the build
fields.name: builtBy

fields.description: Type of the builder
fields.name: buildType

fields.description: Individual predicates found in the attestation
fields.name: slsaPredicate

fields.description: Version of the SLSA predicate
fields.name: slsaVersion

fields.description: Timestamp (RFC3339Nano format) of build start time
fields.name: startedOn

fields.description: Timestamp (RFC3339Nano format) of build end time
fields.name: finishedOn

fields.description: Document from which this attestation is generated from
fields.name: origin

fields.description: GUAC collector for the document
fields.name: collector

types.name: SLSA

types.description:
SLSAInputSpec is the same as SLSA but for mutation input.

All fields are required.
types.name: SLSAInputSpec

types.description:
SLSAPredicate are the values from the SLSA predicate in key-value pair form.

For example, given the following predicate

```
"predicate": {
  "buildDefinition": {
    "externalParameters": {
      "repository": "https://github.com/octocat/hello-world",
      ...
    },
    ...
  },
  ...
}
```

we have

```
key   = "buildDefinition.externalParameters.repository"
value = "https://github.com/octocat/hello-world"
```

This node cannot be directly referred by other parts of GUAC.

TODO(mihaimaruseac): Can we define these directly?
types.name: SLSAPredicate

types.description:
SLSAPredicateInputSpec is the same as SLSAPredicateSpec, but for mutation
input.
types.name: SLSAPredicateInputSpec

types.description: SLSAPredicateSpec is the same as SLSAPredicate, but usable as query input.
types.name: SLSAPredicateSpec

types.description:
Scorecard contains all of the fields present in a Scorecard attestation.

We also include fields to specify under what conditions the check was performed
(time of scan, version of scanners, etc.) as well as how this information got
included into GUAC (origin document and the collector for that document).

fields.description: Individual Scorecard check scores (Branch-Protection, Code-Review, ...)
fields.name: checks

fields.description: Overall Scorecard score for the source
fields.name: aggregateScore

fields.description: Exact timestamp when the source was last scanned (in RFC 3339 format)
fields.name: timeScanned

fields.description: Version of the Scorecard scanner used to analyze the source
fields.name: scorecardVersion

fields.description: Commit of the Scorecards repository at the time of scanning the source
fields.name: scorecardCommit

fields.description: Document from which this attestation is generated from
fields.name: origin

fields.description: GUAC collector for the document
fields.name: collector

types.name: Scorecard

types.description:
ScorecardCheck are the individual checks from scorecard and their values as a
key-value pair.

For example:  Branch-Protection, Code-Review...etc

Based off scorecard's:
type jsonCheckResultV2 struct {
  Details []string                 `json:"details"`
  Score   int                      `json:"score"`
  Reason  string                   `json:"reason"`
  Name    string                   `json:"name"`
  Doc     jsonCheckDocumentationV2 `json:"documentation"`
}
This node cannot be directly referred by other parts of GUAC.
types.name: ScorecardCheck

types.description: ScorecardCheckInputSpec is the same as ScorecardCheck, but for mutation input.
types.name: ScorecardCheckInputSpec

types.description: ScorecardCheckSpec is the same as ScorecardCheck, but usable as query input.
types.name: ScorecardCheckSpec

types.description:
ScorecardInputSpec is the same as Scorecard but for mutation input.

All fields are required.
types.name: ScorecardInputSpec

types.description:
Source represents a source.

This can be the version control system that is being used.

This node is a singleton: backends guarantee that there is exactly one node
with the same `type` value.

Also note that this is named `Source`, not `SourceType`. This is only to make
queries more readable.
types.name: Source

types.description:
SourceInputSpec specifies a source for a mutation.

This is different than SourceSpec because we want to encode that all fields
except tag and commit are mandatory fields. All optional fields are given
empty default values.

It is an error to set both `tag` and `commit` fields to values different than
the default.
types.name: SourceInputSpec

types.description:
SourceName is a url of the repository and its tag or commit.

The `name` field is mandatory. The `tag` and `commit` fields are optional, but
it is an error to specify both.

This is the only source trie node that can be referenced by other parts of
GUAC.
types.name: SourceName

types.description:
SourceNamespace is a namespace for sources.

This is the location of the repository (such as github/gitlab/bitbucket).

The `namespace` field is mandatory.
types.name: SourceNamespace

types.description:
SourceSpec allows filtering the list of sources to return.

Empty string at a field means matching with the empty string. Missing field
means retrieving all possible matches.

It is an error to specify both `tag` and `commit` fields, except it both are
set as empty string (in which case the returned sources are only those for
which there is no tag/commit information).
types.name: SourceSpec

types.description: The `String`scalar type represents textual data, represented as UTF-8 character sequences. The String type is most often used by GraphQL to represent free-form human-readable text.
types.name: String

types.description:
Define the Time scalar, to be used across GUAC. It follows RFC3339Nano format.

This is implicit via https://gqlgen.com/reference/scalars/#time

For GUAC, we assume that all times are stored in UTC format.
types.name: Time

types.description:
VexStatementInputSpec is the same as CertifyVEXStatement but for mutation input.

All fields are required.
types.name: VexStatementInputSpec

fields.description: timeScanned (property) - timestamp of when the package was last scanned
fields.name: timeScanned

fields.description: dbUri (property) - scanner vulnerability database uri
fields.name: dbUri

fields.description: dbVersion (property) - scanner vulnerability database version
fields.name: dbVersion

fields.description: scannerUri (property) - vulnerability scanner's uri
fields.name: scannerUri

fields.description: scannerVersion (property) - vulnerability scanner version
fields.name: scannerVersion

fields.description: origin (property) - where this attestation was generated from (based on which document)
fields.name: origin

fields.description: collector (property) - the GUAC collector that collected the document that generated this attestation
fields.name: collector

types.description:
VulnerabilityInputSpec is the same as VulnerabilityMetaData but for mutation input.

All fields are required.
types.name: VulnerabilityMetaDataInput
